title: Do i have to provide documentation for bankruptcy after 10 years. I need to refinance my house.
question: Filed for bankruptcy 10 years ago. Today i would like to refinance my home mortgage that is 6.7%. Bank is requesting discharge documentation, gave them discharge date. They want the whole list of documents, I dont have those documents anymore. They want me to contact the IRS for those documents. What should I do?
answers: Sounds like you need to work with another lender. Shop around. I have some possibilities for you to consider..

IRS does NOT have those ever. It is sad that they ALWAYS ask you for them when they can themselves download and obtain them by paying $25 a year. That irks me every time I hear this request.

Seems like your interest rate is really high. I hope you tried to increase your credit score too before refinancing as it just seems high.

Good luck though in your pursuit of that refi.
The documents are available through PACER (Public Access to Court Electronic Records) so you or the lender can get the papers. www.pacer.gov login
You get the copies from your attorney or from the court. You can get them from the court website if you set up a PACER account.
